title: Album Page, "Dome of St. Marco, Venice", October 1887
medium: Graphite on cream paperboard adhered to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, bottom right corner of sheet (written perpendicular to drawing): (inscribed in circle) 78; 90. To right of drawing: Dome of St Marco.
description: Horizontal sheet tipped vertically into binding.  The main and best rendered of the three sketches on the sheet is the dome of San Marco, Venice, at left.  The artist has depicted the arcaded cupola and finial in great detail.  To the right are two sketches of chimneys.  Each has a narrow shaft with a trapezoidal cap.  The cap is inverted so that the widest part is at the top of the chimney stack.

tombstone.epitaph:
Album Page, "Dome of St. Marco, Venice", October 1887.
October 1887. Graphite on cream paperboard adhered to thick cream wove paper tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-148.
